channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for iOS/iPadOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Enterprise Application Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Enterprise App Management and the Enterprise App Catalog in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for macOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned Macs into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: Manage Microsoft Edge on iOS and Android With Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Microsoft Edge for iOS and Android to ensure corporate websites are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: Set up local admin account creation and password management for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up macOS account configuration with LAPS through automatic device enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Use Windows compatibility reports for Windows updates in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the app and driver compatibility reports for Windows devices before you deploy Intune policies for feature updates or update rings.

item.title: Turn on iOS/iPadOS supervised mode with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to turn on iOS/iPadOS supervised mode with Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Reports - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Intune provides specific report types with focused views that contain consistent and timely data.

item.title: Guided Update Supersedence for Enterprise App Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to update an Enterprise App Catalog app using supersedence with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add an Enterprise App Catalog App to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add an Enterprise App Catalog app to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Security Copilot Vulnerability Remediation Agent in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to set up and use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent for Security Copilot in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Upgrade the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway server software - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand how Microsoft Tunnel Gateway upgrades to new versions of the tunnel software for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use EPM support approvals for file elevation requests with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Manage support approvals for elevation requests when you use Endpoint Privilege Management for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Assign Apps to Groups in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign an Intune app to groups of users or devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Include and Exclude App Assignments in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to include and exclude app assignments.

item.title: Create a Group to Manage Users - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you'll use Microsoft Intune to create a group based on existing users.

item.title: Settings list for the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint and each settings default value.

item.title: Learn about using Intune to manage Microsoft Defender settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Intune policy to manage Microsoft Defender security settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use third-party certification authorities (CA) with SCEP in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In Microsoft Intune, you can add a vendor or third-party certificate authority (CA) to issue certificates to mobile devices using the SCEP protocol. In this overview, a Microsoft Entra application gives Microsoft Intune permissions to validate certificates. Then, use the application ID, authentication key, and tenant ID of the Microsoft Entra application in the setup of your SCEP server to issue certificates.

item.title: Use Intune to remediate vulnerabilities found by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune Security Tasks to manage threats and vulnerabilities identified by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

item.title: Connect Intune account to managed Google Play account - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to connect your Intune account to your Managed Google Play account.

item.title: Enable Windows Backup for Organizations in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Windows backup and restore in Intune for employees or students.

item.title: Supported filter device and app properties & operators in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: When using filters, get more information on the device properties, supported operators, and supported Windows OS SKUs, including examples. Use these features to create rule expressions in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Learn about the Microsoft Tunnel VPN solution for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway, a VPN server for Intune that runs on Linux. With Microsoft Tunnel, cloud-based devices you manage with Intune can reach your on-premises infrastructure.

item.title: Explore Intune data with natural language and take action - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In Microsoft Intune, use Explorer to query your data in natural language and run built-in queries that match your request. Copilot summarizes the results, and provides recommendations and actions based on the query results. You can also create policies that target users and groups in the query results. Use this feature to explore your Intune data, troubleshoot issues, and create custom reports.

item.title: Control AI features on Android Enterprise devices
item.description: Using Microsoft Intune, you can manage and restrict AI usage on Android devices enrolled in Intune. This guide provides lists the steps in Intune to block AI apps, websites, screen-driven experiences, on-device AI services, and OEM-specific AI features. You can manage Microsoft Copilot, Google Gemini, Samsung Galaxy AI, claude.ai, ChatGPT, and more.

item.title: App Protection Policy Settings for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the app protection policy (APP) settings for MAM on Windows.

item.title: Common tasks and features in the settings catalog - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure common features. You can create a Universal Print policy, configure Microsoft Edge and Google Chrome web browsers, and use built in settings instead of plist files for macOS devices.

item.title: Create filters in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about policy assignment filters, and see the steps to create, update, or delete a filter in Microsoft Intune. Create an assignment filter for managed devices or managed apps scenarios.

item.title: Add and Assign Managed Google Play Apps to Android Enterprise Devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand how to synchronize and assign apps to Android Enterprise devices from the Managed Google Play store.

item.title: Configure the Microsoft Managed Home Screen App - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure the Microsoft Managed Home Screen app.

item.title: Android configuration list for Intune settings catalog - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune settings catalog to add, configure, or restrict features on Android devices. This article lists and describes the settings you can configure.

item.title: Overview of Apple User Enrollment in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Utilize Apple User Enrollment to enroll and manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Troubleshoot Managed Google Play apps on Intune-managed devices - Intune
item.description: Troubleshoot common issues with Managed Google Play for Android Enterprise devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: macOS device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll macOS devices using device enrollment, automated device enrollment (DEP), and Apple Configurator enrollment options in Microsoft Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll iOS and iPadOS devices using user and device enrollment, automated device enrollment (DEP), and Apple Configurator in Microsoft Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove Passcode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to remove a passcode with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Network endpoints for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review endpoints for Intune. This page lists IP addresses and port settings needed for proxy settings in your Intune deployments.

item.title: Monitor your Endpoint Privilege Management policies for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View reports for managed and unmanaged file elevations when you use Endpoint Privilege Management for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage Apple Volume-Purchased Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync apps you bought in volume through Apple Business Manager with Microsoft Intune. Then manage and track these apps on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Intune for increased security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to improve your security posture with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Intune for increased device security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Secure devices with Microsoft Intune to support your Zero Trust journey.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Intune for increased tenant security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Secure your tenant with Microsoft Intune to support your Zero Trust journey.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Intune for increased data security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Secure data on devices with Microsoft Intune to support your Zero Trust journey.

item.title: Data Intune sends to Google - Microsoft Intune
item.description: List of data that Intune sends to Google when Android enterprise device management is enabled with Intune.

item.title: Collect device hardware info with the properties catalog - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the properties catalog in Microsoft Intune view and collect enhanced device hardware info on Windows devices you manage with Intune. You can collect info like BIOS version, TPM status, disk info, memory details, and network adapter configurations. Use this information to get deeper visibility into your device inventory and troubleshoot issues.

item.title: Automatically Hide Devices With Cleanup Rules - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Intune's device cleanup rules offer a simple, automated way to ensure that only actively managed devices remain visible in the admin center. Learn more about device cleanup rules and how to configure them.

item.title: Use derived credentials for mobile devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a third-party partners derived credential as an authentication method for Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Wipe - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to wipe, or factory reset, devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Disable Activation Lock - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Intune to disable Activation Lock on Apple devices.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Find lost devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Locate lost or stolen devices by using the locate device feature in Microsoft Intune. Get details on security and privacy information when using the locate device action.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Collect Diagnostics - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to collect diagnostics with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Retire - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to retire device using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Reset Passcode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to reset a passcode with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Sync - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the device sync remote action in Intune to apply policy, app, and configuration updates to managed devices.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Send Custom Notifications - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune to create and send custom notifications to users of iOS/iPadOS and Android devices.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Delete - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to delete devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Lost Mode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enable Lost Mode in Microsoft Intune to remotely lock a lost or stolen iOS or iPadOS device and display a custom message and phone number on the lock screen.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Update Cellular Data Plan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to update the cellular data plan for iOS/iPadOS devices that support eSIM with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Run Remediation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand remediations with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Logout current user - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the logout the current user from a Shared iPad with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove User - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to remove a user from a Shared iPad with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Full Scan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand Microsoft Defender full scan with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Shutdown - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to shutdown Apple devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: New Remote Assistance Session - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the the new remote assistance session action in Intune to offer support to your users.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Play Lost Mode Sound - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the Play lost device sound remote action in Microsoft Intune to trigger an audible alert on a lost, stolen, or misplaced device—helping users locate it quickly and securely.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Quick Scan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand Microsoft Defender quick scan with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Intune Remote Action: Deprovision - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to deprovision a chromeOS device with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: BitLocker Key Rotation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the BitLocker recovery key with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Actions – Wipe, Lock, Locate, and More - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Discover how to use Microsoft Intune to remotely manage, wipe, lock, restart, and secure Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, Windows, and ChromeOS devices. Learn about available remote actions, prerequisites, and bulk actions for IT admins.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove Apps and Configuration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how apps and configurations can be removed temporarily, then restored automatically or manually using the Remove apps and configuration device action with Intune.

item.title: Intune Remote Action: Rotate FileVault Recovery Key - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the FileVault recovery key with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Rotate local admin password - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the local admin password on Windows and macOS devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Pause Config Refresh - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to temporarily pause policy enforcement on Windows 11 devices using Intune's Pause Config Refresh remote action to support troubleshooting and manual changes.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remote Lock - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the remote lock action in Microsoft Intune to lock a managed device that has a passcode or PIN.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Rename Device - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the Rename device remote action in Microsoft Intune to update the device name shown in the admin center. Useful for standardizing naming conventions, managing shared devices, and improving inventory clarity.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Autopilot Reset - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Autopilot reset with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Fresh Start - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Fresh Start to remove or uninstall apps with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Restart - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to restart managed devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS device settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add, configure, or create settings on iOS/iPadOS devices to restrict features in Microsoft Intune. Create password requirements, control the locked screen, use built-in apps, add restricted or approved apps, handle bluetooth devices, connect to the cloud for backup and storage, enable kiosk mode, add domains, and control how users interact with the Safari web browser.

item.title: Set up Intune enrollment for Android Enterprise dedicated devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure enrollment in Microsoft Intune for Android Enterprise dedicated devices.

item.title: Assign Microsoft Intune licenses - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Assign licenses to users so they can enroll in Intune

item.title: Add users to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add and managing Microsoft Entra user accounts from within Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Remote Help to Assist Users Authenticated by your Organization - Microsoft Intune
item.description: With the Remote Help app, provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app.

item.title: Microsoft Cloud PKI for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: An overview of the Microsoft Cloud PKI service, available with Microsoft Intune Suite or as an Intune add-on.

item.title: Device Query in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use device query in Microsoft Intune to get on-demand device state, run Kusto Query Language (KQL) queries, and troubleshoot devices.

item.title: What is Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Discover what Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics is, how it extends endpoint analytics with advanced device insights, proactive troubleshooting, and enhanced reporting.

item.title: ServiceNow integration with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: ServiceNow integration enables help desk staff, who are licensed to use Remote Help, to use ServiceNow to view incidents and details of the tech issue that an employee is facing from the Troubleshooting pane. This article also describes how to configure ServiceNow integration with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Plan for Remote Help with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the requirements and capabilities of Remote Help with Microsoft Intune on Windows, macOS, and Android Enterprise.

item.title: Managing Elevation Settings for Endpoint Privilege Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View guidance on how to manage the Endpoint Privilege Management client, including reporting level and default elevation response.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Cloud PKI root and issuing CA for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure a root and issuing CA for the Microsoft Cloud PKI service.

item.title: Deployment models for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes the deployment options for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Android FOTA Updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage firmware updates on Android devices. A FOTA update can include software and security patches, feature updates, and other changes to the device's firmware.

item.title: Bring your own certificate authority with Cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a Microsoft Cloud PKI BYOCA issuing CA in Intune and anchor it to an on-premises or private CA.

item.title: Deploy Endpoint Privilege Management with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand the steps and phases for deploying Endpoint Privilege Management with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune cloud PKI fundamentals - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes fundamentals for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Use Endpoint Privilege Management to transition users from administrator to standard user - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand the steps and phases for using Endpoint Privilege Management to transition users from administrators to standard users.

item.title: Anomaly Detection in Endpoint Analytics - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how anomaly detection in Microsoft Intune endpoint analytics proactively monitors device health, detects issues, and provides actionable insights for IT admins.
